plugins.name: CSV to Table in Figma
plugins.description:
Transform your data into editable tables directly within Figma with the CSV to Table plugin. This plugin allows you to easily import and visualize your data in a structured format. Perfect for designers who need to incorporate data tables into their wireframes without the hassle of manual entry.


Key Features:


• Easy Import: Upload CSV files to automatically generate tables.

• Customizable Layouts: Define the number of rows and columns, and customize cell dimensions.

• Drag and Drop: Convenient drag-and-drop functionality for file uploads.

• Data Visualization: Instantly convert raw data into a clean, editable table format.

• Integration: Seamlessly works within Figma to enhance your design workflow.


Say goodbye to tedious data entry and hello to efficient data visualization. Enhance your Figma projects with structured tables in just a few clicks!
plugins.tagline: Transform Data Files into Editable Tables in Figma

plugins.name: QuikA11y
plugins.description:
Make accessibility seamless. Reference with confidence.


Good design requires understanding accessibility, and you want your design decisions to feel informed. While many accessibility tools exist, they don't focus on educating teams about key standards and guidelines. That's the gap QuikA11y fills — making accessibility education effortless, quick, and easy to find.


QuikA11y is a plugin that focuses on educating accessibility standards. Discover instant access to WCAG 2.2 guidelines and empower your design process with expert knowledge and educational insights.


Features:

  1. Quick search on WCAG 2.2 guidelines
  2. Reference all WCAG 2.2 standards and success criteria
  3. Key links to essential WCAG documents and resources
  4. Share accessibility rationales with your team
  5. Place reference notes directly in your designs
  6. Educate and build accessibility awareness
  7. Light and Dark theme to match your preference
  8. Native Figma look and feel

accepted.name: Alex Vong
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Alex;✌️ I'm a designer and front-end developer passionate about crafting beautiful and delightful user interactions through modern web technology.

plugins.tagline: Make accessibility seamless. Reference with confidence.

plugins.name: Figmentation
plugins.description:
🪄 Figmentation – where Figma meets Autodocumentation


Tired of manual documentation?

Figmentation automates the process of extracting design tokens directly from your Figma components — including colors, typography, spacing, borders, and effects.

With just one click, Figmentation creates a clean, organized annotation frame beside your component — making handoff easier for developers and keeping your design system crystal clear.


Built by a designer who needed this — and figured others might too.


💡 What it does:

Extracts bound design tokens from your components

Supports multiple naming conventions (camelCase, kebab-case, etc.)

Automatically detects and documents:

Backgrounds, text colors, border colors

Font sizes, families, weights, line heights, letter spacing

Padding, gap, corner radius, stroke weight

Shadows and blurs

Generates readable and structured annotation layers

Keeps token names consistent with your system — or generates smart fallback names


🔧 Use cases:

Design system maintenance

Dev handoff

Figma token organization

Fast, scalable documentation for UI libraries


✨ Made for:

Product designers

Design system leads

Developers using Figma tokens

Anyone who hates repetitive documentation


🎯 Figmentation – where Figma meets Autodocumentation.

Crafted with care by someone who gets it.
plugins.tagline: Where Figma meets Auto-documentation

plugins.name: Logger
plugins.description:
Logger is a Figma plugin designed to help users log changes made to pages and frames within their Figma projects. The plugin provides an easy-to-use interface with two tabs: "Page log" and "Frame log".


Features

Page Log Tab:

  1. A text area box with the placeholder "Describe the change" where users can enter the change made to the page (mandatory field).
  2. A smaller text box with the placeholder "Change requested by" where users can enter the name of the person who requested the change (optional field).
  3. A "Log change" button that is enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled.

Frame Log Tab:

  1. A drop-down menu with the default value "Select frame" that shows the list of frames on the current page. Users can also select a frame directly on the page, and the frame name will be populated in the drop-down (mandatory field).
  2. A text area box with the placeholder "Describe the change" where users can enter the change made to the frame (mandatory field).
  3. A smaller text box with the placeholder "Change requested by" where users can enter the name of the person who requested the change (optional field).
  4. A "Log change" button that is enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled.


Usage Instructions

Page Log:

  1. Navigate to the "Page log" tab.
  2. Enter the description of the change in the "Describe the change" text area.
  3. (Optional) Enter the name of the person who requested the change in the "Change requested by" text box.
  4. Click the "Log change" button (enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled).

Frame Log:

  1. Navigate to the "Frame log" tab.
  2. Select a frame from the "Select frame" drop-down menu or directly select a frame on the page.
  3. Enter the description of the change in the "Describe the change" text area.
  4. (Optional) Enter the name of the person who requested the change in the "Change requested by" text box.
  5. Click the "Log change" button (enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled).


Logic

Page Log:

  1. When the user clicks the "Log change" button, the plugin checks if there is a page named "Change log" in Figma. If not, it creates one.
  2. The plugin then creates a text field with the name of the page for which the log is created within the "Change log" page and adds the following values: Date and time of the log, User's name requesting the change, Change description
  3. If the page and text already exist, the plugin appends the new values to the existing text.

Frame Log:

  1. When the user clicks the "Log change" button, the plugin checks if there is a text field on the frame with the name "Frame log". If not, it creates the text field within the selected frame (top left corner) and adds the following values:
  2. Date and time of the log
  3. User's name requesting the change
  4. Change description
  5. If the text field already exists, the plugin appends the new values to the existing text within the frame.


Conclusion

Logger is a powerful plugin for tracking changes in Figma projects, making it easier to manage and document modifications to pages and frames. With its intuitive interface and robust logging capabilities, Logger is an essential plugin for any Figma user.
plugins.tagline: A simple native plugin helping designers log their changes both at page as well as frame level.

plugins.name: Find All My Fonts
plugins.description:
Find My Fonts provides a detailed and structured report of all fonts used in your Figma design.

  1. Get a complete overview of all fonts used in your file
  2. Detect unaccounted or hidden fonts across pages and frames
  3. Find repeated text names that may indicate duplicates
  4. Identify fonts inside hidden layers, components, and instances
  5. Choose between analyzing the current page, all pages, or selected frames
  6. Filter by text-only layers, hidden content, or component structure
  7. Group results by font family, font size, or duplicate names
  8. Select matching layers directly from the report
  9. Export the full font usage report to PDF for further review or documentation

The plugin supports 9 languages and has a clean interface with light and dark theme.
plugins.tagline: fonts, report, text layers, hidden text, duplicates, components, pdf export, fontfamily, fontstyle

plugins.name: FigJam Planning Card Creator
plugins.description:
Add structured planning cards to your FigJam boards for agile planning and project management. This plugin helps teams quickly create consistent planning cards with fields like objectives, dependencies, requirements, and time estimates.


Key features:

  1. Import multiple cards at once using YAML or JSON format
  2. Create custom cards with structured fields (title, objective, dependencies, requirements, estimated lift, dates)
  3. Smart placement options - add cards inside sections or below any selection
  4. Pre-formatted cards with proper styling and typography
  5. Great for setting up sprint planning, backlog grooming, and project roadmapping


Works with sections and sticky notes. Select where you want cards and choose from built-in templates, create custom cards, or paste card definitions to bulk import.


📄 YAML/JSON Templates & Examples

📖 Documentation

🏢 Made by Prelude
plugins.tagline: Create structured planning cards for agile workflows using templates or bulk import

plugins.name: RocketPen - Generate UI with AI and edit freely
plugins.description:
Product Introduction


RocketPen is a tool that leverages artificial intelligence (AI) to help users create UI designs.

RocketPen aims to significantly boost your productivity.


Value

📌Open Editing Permissions: AI-generated designs can be flexibly edited and modified

🚀Boost Design Efficiency: Smart generation replaces manual drawing

🎨Maintain Design Consistency: Automatically adapts to brand design specifications

💬Natural Language Interaction: Generate professional designs with simple descriptions

📱Multi-platform Design Support: Unified design for Web/Mobile/Desktop platforms

📦Design Asset Reuse: Convert existing websites into editable Figma files


Features

Text-to-Design Generation

Generate UI design drafts based on DesignTokens through text descriptions


Website-to-Design File Conversion

Convert any website into editable Figma design files, requires use with the Chrome extension RocketPenSelector


DesignToken

Support variables definition for DesignToken with visual DesignToken output


Quick Chart Generation

Support common chart types including bar charts, line charts, pie charts, radar charts, etc.


Precise Content Generation

Generate corresponding content through text descriptions within specified Frames


Precise Resource Import

Import icons, images and other resources through text descriptions:

Generate four high-definition animal images


Generate a navigation bar with four buttons: Chat, Contacts, Discover, Settings



Notes

🔒 Privacy Protection: We do not store any user data. Only DesignTokens (variables) are uploaded, and all generated design files remain stored locally on your device. Your data security is fully protected.


🚧 Development Status: This plugin is currently in active development. We're continuously refining the model and workflows to deliver higher-quality design outputs and an improved user experience.



Thank you for your support and understanding! If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to provide feedback.
plugins.tagline: Your Vision,AI-Powered.Generate UI designs instantly with AI, then edit freely to match your vision

plugins.name: Variable Linter
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps analyze, audit, and replace variables in your Figma designs. Scan selected layers for bound variables, categorize them by source, and efficiently replace variables with those from approved collections.


Features


🔍 Variable Analysis


Deep Scanning: Analyzes nested components, variants, and instances

Source Categorization: Identifies variables as local, team library, or orphaned

Type-Safe Analysis: Categorizes variables by type (color, number, string, boolean)

Real-time Results: Instant scanning of selected layers


📊 Variable Management


Approval System: Mark specific variable collections as approved replacement sources

Bulk Operations: Replace multiple variables of the same type simultaneously

Individual Replacement: Replace variables one at a time with precise control

Orphan Detection: Identifies variables that no longer exist in their collections


🎯 Smart Filtering


Toggle Views: Switch between all variables and unapproved variables only

Sortable Tables: Sort by name, type, value, or source

Search & Filter: Find specific variables quickly


📋 Team Library Integration


Library Detection: Automatically identifies team libraries and shared collections

Permission Management: Configure which collections can be used as replacement sources

Compatibility Checking: Ensures replacement variables match original types
plugins.tagline: Scans for variables in a selection and reports the source(s) of those variables.

plugins.name: Fair Colors
plugins.description:
Fair Colors is a Figma plugin designed to streamline your color workflow, helping you manage, apply, and audit colors within your designs.


Key Features:


Extract Colors: Quickly grab all unique colors from your current selection, including solid fills and gradients.

Organize Palettes: Create and manage multiple color palettes, giving them custom names for easy organization.

Apply & Replace: Effortlessly apply saved colors to selected layers or replace existing colors throughout your selection.

Smart Highlighting: Instantly highlight all layers in your canvas that use a specific color, making auditing and adjustments a breeze.

Track Changes: Identify and manage color discrepancies by generating a "Fair Colors Changes" frame that visually shows differences between your saved palette and colors found in your selection.

Export Tokenized Colors: Generate a clean, tokenized reference frame of your used colors, perfect for design system documentation or developer handoff.

Fair Color helps you maintain consistency, identify rogue colors, and accelerate your design process by putting powerful color management tools right at your fingertips.
plugins.tagline: Local Color Palette System

138007.name: Fair Colors
138007.description:
Fair Colors is a Figma plugin designed to streamline your color workflow, helping you manage, apply, and audit colors within your designs.


Key Features:


Extract Colors: Quickly grab all unique colors from your current selection, including solid fills and gradients.

Organize Palettes: Create and manage multiple color palettes, giving them custom names for easy organization.

Apply & Replace: Effortlessly apply saved colors to selected layers or replace existing colors throughout your selection.

Smart Highlighting: Instantly highlight all layers in your canvas that use a specific color, making auditing and adjustments a breeze.

Track Changes: Identify and manage color discrepancies by generating a "Fair Colors Changes" frame that visually shows differences between your saved palette and colors found in your selection.

Export Tokenized Colors: Generate a clean, tokenized reference frame of your used colors, perfect for design system documentation or developer handoff.

Fair Color helps you maintain consistency, identify rogue colors, and accelerate your design process by putting powerful color management tools right at your fingertips.

plugins.name: Image Uploader
plugins.description:
Transform Figma design into HTML and CSS is a powerful Figma plugin that helps you convert your Figma designs into clean, responsive HTML and CSS using AI model capabilities. With an intuitive multi-view UI inside Figma and a backend server that fetches image previews and processes visual data into code, This plugin empowers developers and designers to rapidly prototype web interfaces without manual slicing or coding.


Usage instructions


Prerequisites

  1. Node.js installed
  2. An OpenAI API key
  3. A Figma Personal Access Token (PAT)
  4. A Figma file with share access


Setup

npm install express openai dotenv node-fetch cors archiver


Set Environment Variables:

  1. Create a .env file in your project root with:
  2. OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_key


Run the Backend Server:

node server.js

This starts a local server at: http://localhost:3000

  1. Using the Plugin (UI inside Figma)
  2. Upload the plugin manifest and code.js + ui.html in Figma’s "Plugins > Development > New Plugin".
  3. Run the plugin from within Figma.
  4. On first view, click "Upload Figma File" to navigate to the second screen.
  5. Paste the Figma file URL and Figma API Token, then click Submit URL.
  6. A preview gallery of Figma frames will load. Click a thumbnail to select one.
  7. Preview the selected frame in the third view. Click Submit to generate code.


Output

The backend sends the image to OpenAI GPT-4o for code generation.


You receive a downloadable generated-ui.zip with:

html/

index.html

css/

styles.css
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma designs to responsive HTML / CSS instantly with AI-powered models accuracy and speed

plugins.name: CSV text replace
plugins.description:
このプラグインは、Figma上のテキストレイヤーをCSVを使って効率的に一括置換・エクスポートできるツールです。

Figmaでのテキスト管理が多いプロジェクトや翻訳ワークフローに最適なプラグインです。


【主な機能】

①テキストの一括置換

CSVファイルにA列＝検索対象、B列＝置換内容を記述し、プラグインに読み込ませるだけで、Figma内の該当テキストを自動的に置き換えます。


②テキストのエクスポート

選択したフレームやテキストレイヤー内の文字列をCSV形式で書き出し。翻訳や編集作業との連携に最適です。


【使い方】

プラグイン起動後、

「リプレイス」タブでCSVファイルをアップロードし置換を実行

「エクスポート」タブでは、選択中のテキストをCSVでダウンロード可能

フレームを選択した状態では、そのフレームに含まれる全てのテキストレイヤーを一括でCSV化してダウンロードします


----


This plugin allows you to bulk replace and export text layers in Figma using CSV files—perfect for efficient content updates and translation workflows.

Highly useful for localization, bulk edits, or working with external editors.


[Key Features]

①Bulk Replace Text

Simply upload a CSV file where column A = target text and column B = replacement text. The plugin will find and replace matching text layers in your Figma file.


②Export Text

Export text content from selected frames or layers into a CSV file. Ideal for translation or review processes.


[How to Use]

Open the plugin and go to the “Replace” tab to upload your CSV and execute replacement.

Use the “Export” tab to download the text from selected layers as a CSV file.

When a frame is selected, all text layers within that frame will be exported together as a CSV file.
plugins.tagline: Replace and export text layers in Figma via CSV. CSVでテキストを一括置換＆エクスポート。

plugins.name: QR Code Automation
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to update / replace all QR codes in your Figma file with just one click! You have the total control over sizes, and Color!


How to use it:


  1. Create a text layer.
  2. Name the text layer "QR-Link". (You can change the content of this layer at any time — the name should remain "QR-Link".)
  3. Create one or multiple rectangles (squares) and name them "QR-Code".
  4. Create a second text layer
  5. Name the text layer "QR-color", and add the Hex code of the color you want your QR-Code to have inside the text layer.
  6. Run the Plugin


The plugin will generate a QR code using the content from the "QR-Link" text layer. It will place the QR code over each rectangle named "QR-Code" and match the dimensions of the rectangle. If the rectangle is inside a frame, the QR code will be placed inside that frame as well.


If you run the plugin again, the existing QR codes will be replaced with the updated ones.


Hint:

  1. It's not a problem if there are multiple text layers named "QR-Link" — just make sure that all of them contain the exact same text content. Otherwise, the plugin will not run.
  2. It does not matter if you add the Hex-code with or without the #
plugins.tagline: Auto update multiple QR-Codes with one click

plugins.name: Bulk Certificate Generator / Generador Masivo de Certificados
plugins.description:
How does this plugin work?


Users can automate the creation of personalized certificates inside Figma, avoiding the manual copy-pasting of required data.



Step-by-step: How to use the plugin


1 - Create the base design in Figma

  1. Design a certificate inside a Frame or Component.
  2. Use text layers named like #NAME, #COURSE, #DATE, etc.
  3. These names will be automatically replaced with data from the Sheet.


2 – Prepare the Google Sheet

  1. Create a public Google Sheet.
  2. In the first row, write the field names: NAME, COURSE, DATE, ID, etc.
  3. Fill the rows with each person’s data.
  4. Make sure the document is public (set to “Anyone with the link can view”).


3 – Select your design in Figma

  1. Select the Frame or Component containing your base design.
  2. Only one selection is allowed when running the plugin.


4 – Open the plugin

  1. Run the plugin from the Figma menu.
  2. Paste the Google Sheet link.
  3. Enter the sheet name (e.g., Students).
  4. Toggle the “Show ID” option on or off if you want to hide it.


5 – Preview (optional)

  1. Click “Preview” to generate just one sample certificate.


6 – Generate certificates

  1. Click “Generate.”
  2. The plugin will clone your base design, replace the fields, and automatically arrange the certificates on the Figma page.


7 - Have fun!
plugins.tagline: Diseñá uno, generá cientos. Certificados personalizados en Figma desde un Google Sheet.

139581.name: Bulk Certificate Generator / Generador Masivo de Certificados
139581.description:
How does this plugin work?


Users can automate the creation of personalized certificates inside Figma, avoiding the manual copy-pasting of required data.



Step-by-step: How to use the plugin


1 - Create the base design in Figma

  1. Design a certificate inside a Frame or Component.
  2. Use text layers named like #NAME, #COURSE, #DATE, etc.
  3. These names will be automatically replaced with data from the Sheet.


2 – Prepare the Google Sheet

  1. Create a public Google Sheet.
  2. In the first row, write the field names: NAME, COURSE, DATE, ID, etc.
  3. Fill the rows with each person’s data.
  4. Make sure the document is public (set to “Anyone with the link can view”).


3 – Select your design in Figma

  1. Select the Frame or Component containing your base design.
  2. Only one selection is allowed when running the plugin.


4 – Open the plugin

  1. Run the plugin from the Figma menu.
  2. Paste the Google Sheet link.
  3. Enter the sheet name (e.g., Students).
  4. Toggle the “Show ID” option on or off if you want to hide it.


5 – Preview (optional)

  1. Click “Preview” to generate just one sample certificate.


6 – Generate certificates

  1. Click “Generate.”
  2. The plugin will clone your base design, replace the fields, and automatically arrange the certificates on the Figma page.


7 - Have fun!
139581.tagline: Diseñá uno, generá cientos. Certificados personalizados en Figma desde un Google Sheet.

plugins.description:

This is tool is helpful to find mis-matched items based on the given parameters.

plugins.name: SnapCap
plugins.description:
Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your FigJam board or Figma Design file in a single click, making it easier than ever to document user experiences as you browse the web.


Please note that to use SnapCap, you will also need to install the companion Chrome extension at snapcap.app/extension


How to Use SnapCap

Installation

  1. Install the Figma plugin
  2. Install the Chrome browser extension, and pin it


Session Setup

  1. Open the FigJam board or Figma Design file where you wish to send screenshots
  2. Launch the Figma plugin and click "Start new session"
  3. Copy the generated session code
  4. Click on the SnapCap browser extension and enter the copied session code


Taking Screenshots

Once your session has connected, click on the SnapCap browser extension anytime you want to take a screenshot and send it to your Figma file. A check mark will be shown on the extension icon to indicate that the screenshot was captured successfully, and it will show up moments later in the Figma file where the FigCap plugin is running.


Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your Figma files

plugins.name: Fig-Refactor
plugins.description:
Call for Sponsorship: Support the Development


Fig-Refactor – Replace Spacing with Figma Variables in One Click


Fig-Refactor is a Figma plugin designed to bring structure and scalability to your design files by replacing hardcoded gaps and paddings with Figma variables — in bulk.


Fig-Refactor intelligently scans your selection or entire file, matches raw spacing values to the closest variable from your local or team library, and replaces them with a single click. It even skips values already using variables, keeping your workflow non-destructive and efficient.


✨ Features:

  1. 🔍 Smart matching – Suggests the closest variable for each spacing value
  2. 🧠 Supports team libraries – Load and use variables from shared libraries
  3. 📁 Flexible scanning – Target specific selections or scan the entire file
  4. 🚫 Non-destructive – Ignores values already assigned to a variable


Currently in active development, Fig-Refactor is already making design systems cleaner and easier to manage — and with your support, it can go even further. Your sponsorship helps fund ongoing development, bug fixes, and new features like auto-thresholds, preview modes, and batch review.


📹 DEMO

❤️ Support this project


Your support helps keep this plugin alive and evolving.

Thank you for making design better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Refactor Your  Figma Spacing  in Seconds

plugins.name: Export to Denada
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
plugins.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
121997.release_notes: Allow exporting any layer, not just Frame layers.
121997.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.
